questions.question: What is React.js

choices.choice: JavaScript front-end library to create a database
Free and open-source JavaScript front-end library

questions.explanation: React.js is a free and open-source JavaScript front-end library for creating user interfaces and UI components. It’s also referred to as React or ReactJS.

questions.question: Which of the following acts as the input of a class-based component?
questions.explanation: React allows users to pass information to a Component using props. Props are kind of global variable or object.

questions.question: React.js is written in which of the following language?
questions.explanation: React Native is built on a JavaScript based React.js framework. This is a significant benefit, given that JavaScript is such a widely used language.

questions.question: How many elements can a valid react component return?
questions.explanation: A valid react component can return only one element.

questions.question: In which of the following directory React Components are saved?
questions.explanation: Inside src/components/ directory React Components are saved.

questions.question: Which of the following command is used to Install create-react-app?
questions.explanation: The “npm install -g create-react-app” command is used to install the create-react-app.

questions.question: In which condition is the React.js Lifecycle method static getDerivedSateFromProps(props, state) is called?

choices.choice: When the state of the component is updated
When a component is created for the first time

questions.explanation: In React. js, the static getDerivedSateFromProps(props, state) is called in both the cases when a component is created and when a component is updated.

questions.question: Which of the following is method is not a part of ReactDOM?
questions.explanation: ReactDOM.destroy() method is not a part of ReactDOM. ReactDOM provides the developers with an API containing the methods such as render(), findDOMNode(), unmountComponentAtNode(), hydrate(), and createPortal().

questions.question: Which of the following is correct about prop in react?

choices.choice: Can be changed inside another component
Can be changed inside the component
Cannot be changed in the component

questions.explanation: Props cannot be changed, they are immutable. A prop is a special keyword, that stands for properties.

questions.question: Which of the following is used to pass data to a component from outside in React?
questions.explanation: Props can be used to pass dynamic data to a component. When the data in the props changes, the component re-renders.
